http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Theatre Curriculum Standards for 3rd grade.
Script Writing - Students will create scripts through planning and recording improvisations based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history.
Explore the principles of scene writing.
Participate in script writing by exploring story elements.
Use personal situations in the creation of scripted scenes.
Express character through dialogue.
Character Acting - Students will develop basic acting skills by assuming roles and interacting in improvisation.
Explore sensory and emotional experiences to create a character.
Use imagination to form and express thought, feeling and character.
Create characters to develop scenarios in individual and group settings.
Examine improvisational skills and techniques in creating a character.
Explore movement to express feeling and characterization.
Utilize the voice to express feeling and characterization.
Scene Design - Students will design by visualizing and arranging environments for classroom dramatizations.
Explore the functions of various technical elements such as visual elements and aural qualities.
Determine design elements needed for classroom dramatizations.
Select and demonstrate safe use of appropriate costumes, properties and scenery for classroom dramatizations.
Directing - Students will direct by planning classroom dramatizations.
Explore the responsibilities of the director.
Develop collaborative decisionmaking skills for classroom dramatizations.
Research - Students will research by finding information to support classroom dramatizations.
Examine information that can be used to create individual roles or classroom dramatizations.
Theatrical Presentation - Students will compare and connect art forms by describing theatre, dramatic media (such as film, television, and electronic media) and other art forms.
Identify ways in which other art forms contrast and/or relate to theatre.
Describe elements of other art forms used in a dramatic production.
Incorporate other art forms into the creation of dramatic projects.
Understand the role of the audience and demonstrate appropriate audience etiquette.
Scene Comprehension - Students will analyze and explain personal preferences and construct meanings from classroom dramatizations, theatre, film, and multimedia productions.
Respond to selected theatrical experiences.
Examine creative drama and formal theatre, film and television.
Context - Students will understand cultural context by recognizing the role of theatre, film, television and electronic media in daily life.
Examine how various cultures are reflected through theatre, film, television and electronic media.
Understand the role of theatre, film, television and electronic media in daily life.
